description: Just lack window with x3 in title. React on Ctrl + +-, but only in title..
Not worthy of being included in Ubuntu offering.
so you have to drag from within the display window, onto the section you want to zoom in on, then release.

Could use description for use, and ideally wouldn't render itself in the tab causing an input loop so you could use the entire screen, but no other app I saw magnifies a still spot on the screen, which is what I wanted to watch lectures with a strange format (2 small screens in one mp4 but only one is used)
I tried to use it to magnify part of the video while it was paused, it didn't let me do that.
the window contents is just a black rectangle.
Only displays a black screen.

1 When you start the App, You can move it to the best position, then Click into the xzoom box that opened.

2 Hold mouse button down and drag the bounding box over the area you want to magnify and release.

3 You can adjust the the amount of area it covers, by dragging the edges or corner of the xzoom box.

4 Press + or - to change zoom level (Default is 2).

5 You can Flip Horizontally, Vertically or Rotate using X,Y,Z keys.

6 You can use Cursor Up, Down, Left and Right to fine tune the selected area.

7 Pressing D cycles through the update rate in ms 0 - 200, in case you are magnifying a moving image.

8 Pressing G turns a Grid on and off.

9 Press Q to quit or the X in the top bar.

Tips, All commands are used while clicked into the App (Top xzoom bar).

You can right click the top xzoom bar and set always on top, to avoid loosing xzoom under a window you are trying to look at.

If you click and it goes full screen just double click the top xzoom bar to bring it back to normal.

If it zooms in recursively, you have selected an area over the xzoom box itself.

This App is for magnifying an area that is selected and reflects changes in that area, it's not the type that follows the mouse.
 
I hope all my descriptions help and give this app the recognition it deserves, I've been using it for years.
summary: Great and easy to use App, if you learn how to use it!
